resources.string: A Cold Welcome
Skye is reporting news of unusual Varangian activity in Great Cleave. Go to investigate and put a stop to their plans.
<g id="g_grace_consider" />If you're wondering where Rima is, she's off having a talk with our good friend Skye the Spear Daughter.
<g id="g_grace_sorry" />Apparently, Skye's not back for our bad jokes. She's got quite the serious face.
<g id="g_grace_consider" />If you're wondering where Rima is, she's bringing along a Spear Daughter by the name of Skye.
<g id="g_grace_sorry" />Apparently, Skye's not visiting to hear our famously bad jokes. Her message seemed pretty urgent.
"What's going on?"
<g id="g_grace_goaway" />Damned if I know! Seems our Spear Daughter wants your ear alone - as if the rest of us lot<g id="g_grace_shrugdontknow" /> were untrustworthy.
<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" />Eh, maybe I'm in a mood. We should hear her out.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> Maybe check with her, find out what's going on?
"I take it she's not paying."
<g id="g_grace_frustrated" priority="high" />Och, if it were up to you and Zander, we'd be working for wishes. Least Rima's got a nose for profit.
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Well, they'll be along any minute. Let's see what Skye says, and if it's a charity case, tell her<g id="g_grace_laughs" priority="high" /> absolutely- not. Ha!
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />Let me know what you find out.<g id="g_grace_convince1" /> And remember, it's 'in business,' not 'in charity!'

<g id="g_male_compliment" />It feels like the first warm breeze of Spring to<g id="g_female_spreadarms" /> be here again with all of you. And<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> though it seems your camp is still-<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> being worked on,<g id="g_female_nodyes" /> it feels a fine home.

<g id="g_male_compliment" />It stirs the heart to stand with a group of warriors of such skill. And this camp-<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> it is not as ugly<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> as I had heard.<g id="g_female_nodyes" /> It feels a fine home to me.

<g id="g_male_agree1" />Ah, my friend! Listen to me-<g id="g_female_leanforwardlistennod" /> Rima asked, why Spear Daughters think<g id="g_female_explains" /> the most important part of their weapon is the haft.
<g id="g_male_explain" />Then she says, that is not the point!<g id="g_female_shrugdontcare" /> What is not the point?<g id="g_male_righthandangry" /> Why is she laughing?
(Dog twitches his tail playfully. He seems happy there's more people around. Has he grown a bit bigger?)
<g id="g_female_sighrelief" />It is wonderful to see you again!<g id="g_male_shakehead" /> Yet I wish I bore better news.<g id="g_female_crossarms" /> It's the Varangians.

<g id="g_female_youknow" />They've raided a village in Great Cleave.<g id="g_female_worry" /> Strange thing is, it's a tiny homestead- trappers, miners.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> Normally they would not bother.
<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" />What an honor to meet you, Soulwarden!<g id="g_male_itsokay" /> And yet I wish I bore better news. It's<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> the Varangians.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />They've raided a village in south Great Cleave, but the<g id="g_female_worry" /> strange thing is, it's a tiny homestead. Normally they would not bother.
"We should see what they're up to."
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />I had hoped you would say that. It<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> may sound strange, but<g id="g_female_sighrelief" /> in a way, I'm glad.

<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" />I haven't forgotten all you've done for me, and- and it will be nice to<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> work together with you again.<g id="g_male_headshakeno" /> Well I suppose<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> we should go!
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />I had hoped you would say that. It<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> may sound strange, but<g id="g_female_sighrelief" /> in a way, I'm glad.

<g id="g_male_compliment" />I've heard many tales of your valor in battle, and now, to meet the legend in person! Ah, I suppose<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> we should go.<g id="g_female_youknow" /> I will meet you there.

string.comment: fearful, thought he saw something, cries out
string.speaker: Quam Okpara
string.name: QuamOkpara

resources.string: Ahh! No!

string.comment: hiding, hums softly to soothe himself
string.speaker: Quam Okpara
string.name: QuamOkpara

resources.string: (Hums) Hmm hm hmm. It's fine. No, they'll see me. They'll see right through these holes in the roof!

string.comment: thinking he can rush out and take on the Varangians
string.speaker: Quam Okpara
string.name: QuamOkpara

resources.string: You know what? I'll take them on alone! Give them a share or two of pain, I will.

string.comment: whispers loudly to himself, feeling the failure of what's happened to the village
string.speaker: Quam Okpara
string.name: QuamOkpara

resources.string: Failure! What kind of headman am I? A weak one. You're weak, Quam!

string.comment: hears the player get near. From this point on he's silent until player comes in.
string.speaker: Quam Okpara
string.name: QuamOkpara

resources.string: Who's that! Is- is somebody there?
This is a hard land, but we eked out a spare living from this cold earth. Fallen to wreck and ruin in an instant!
Have any of the others survived? Will they return? Hope now seems as far away as the moon in the sky.
Oh! You're not with those Varangians, are you? They are not men, they are monsters! The cruelty. The things they have done.
Why? We are simple folk! We've no ring of theirs!
"What ring are they looking for?"
Would that I knew! They killed. Burned our homes. Took our meager possessions. All for a ring. What ring, we said! What ring!
Their leader- he took to the cliffs behind the village. But you must flee! It is not safe here!
<g id="g_female_handsonhipsshakehead" />I do not know who this man is, but he makes me want to<g id="g_male_clenchfistsgetpumped02" /> lend my spear to his face.
<g id="g_female_crossarms" />We have a word for him where I come from, but I had better not say it. They say the<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> gods are always watching.
Who are you people? I've no time for foolish banter. Away, before I lose my patience.
What a world, where churls may freely bother Knights! Something I'll change very soon, to be sure.
Looking for a challenge, are you? As much as I would relish a fight, I have more important things to attend to.
Oh why must I, Mordred, a Knight of the Round Table, answer to these filthy, nosy, commoners!
"Did King Artorius send you?"
Artorius? The blustering doddard! He hasn't the will nor the strength to endure my path. His absence is the clearest proof of that.
But lo, the mystery continues! Why am I still talking to these plebeians? Out of my way.
Do not try your fancy words with me. Stand back, or I will crush you back into the mud where you belong.
Make no mistake, I love the villagers. I can still taste their sad little mewls of pain - like fresh milk.
Ah, I wonder how you sound when you cry for mercy? It must be absolutely delicious.

<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />The villager said they were searching for a ring? That<g id="g_female_gestureleftm" /> Mordred bastard came out of<g id="g_female_lookright" /> those caves- might be worth a look.
<g id="g_male_crossarmsupset" />Ah, we should have kept him from leaving. And<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> stuck him a few times while we were at it.
"I'll take a look at the caves."
<g id="g_female_salutefistchest" />Then I will guard your return.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> Tch! The sooner we wipe Aeternum clean of these Varangian scum, the better.
I'm sorry.<g id="g_female_notsure" /> Letting the forge spill onto the rushes, as Aidyn used to say.<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> Stay safe in there.

<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Let me know what you find, and<g id="g_female_leanforwardlistennod" /> be wary. I wouldn't put it past those craven dogs to lay<g id="g_male_dismissgetlost2" /> a trap or two.

Idiotic villagers. How does one suffer such peasants and their incessant bleating? No matter, for I've located the ring. Now this damned ice deters me from my prize. How to shatter it. Perhaps- yes, the type of fire was wrong.
Idiotic villagers. How does one suffer such peasants and their incessant bleating? No matter, for I've located the ring.
Now this damned ice deters me from my prize. How to shatter it. Perhaps- yes, the type of fire was wrong.
<g id="g_male_handshipsdisapprove" />So he did find that ring he wanted? Ill luck to that swaggering croc.

<g id="g_female_tiltheadremember" priority="high" />Wait- that name, Mordred… Mordred.<g id="g_female_explains" /> Aidyn told me, years ago. There was a madman who<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> went by that name, living alone in a small cabin,<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> just north of Bastion Outpost.
"I should go to the cabin."

<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />Good, you may find clues as to<g id="g_female_gesturerights" /> what he seeks.<g id="g_female_youknow" /> I will return to the Crow's Nest<g id="g_male_nod2" /> and let Grace know what we learned.
<g id="g_male_think" />Perhaps the others may know more about this ring.<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> Something tells me there is<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> more to it than we realize.
<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" />As terrible as things seem<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" />, it is thrilling to stand by your side!<g id="g_male_waghand01" /> Ah, I am- it's embarrassing.
<g id="g_male_sighrelief" />Hundreds of years in this life, and still I'm not able to leash my tongue.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> It is- a bit warm here.
If I had but a coin for every time my wayward son blundered into trouble.
A fine puzzle. I've neither the time nor the taste for ridiculous notions such as maternal duty. And yet, here I am.
So the Silver Crows are here. Let me guess. You're here looking for my son, Mordred. Ha! Don't be so surprised.
It took no enchantment to puzzle those pieces. That arrogant, misguided fool. What trouble is he after now?
"A ring, and a Frosted Crown?"
Ah, the Frosted Crown. Poor King Idris. Stole the crown from its resting place, and it drove him mad. Sealed his castle in ice.
I doubt an army of fire mages could breach his gate now. But what does my son want with it?
"I was hoping you might know."
Ha! If only I could answer what my fool of a son wants or why. A ring, a crown. Has he got into my manuscripts again?
I'll look into it, and find you after I've learned something. Meantime, here's where you can find King Idris.
<g id="g_female_notsure" />Mordred is Morgaine's son? Their only commonality may<g id="g_male_righthandnodeal" /> be their lack of commonality with others.

<g id="g_male_throwarms" />If it were Morgaine wanting this ring and crown,<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> maybe I'd have no qualms- but her evil get, Mordred?<g id="g_male_shakehead" /> It ties my stomach in knots.
"He's human like the rest of us."
<g id="g_female_crossarms" />Is he? Is a man who does evil, still worthy of being called "human?"<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" /> You may believe in second chances.

But I say,<g id="g_male_itsokay" /> the fox will always eat the hen.<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> Question is, how do we put this fox in a cage?<g id="g_male_pointblame" /> We have to beat him to his prize.
"We need strong magical fire."
<g id="g_female_headnodding" />Aye, if we're to<g id="g_male_handshipsconsider" /> get that crown before Mordred does, we need a way into the ice castle. Perhaps someone who can wield magic fire?
<g id="g_female_tiltheadremember" priority="high" />Of sorcerers, I know precious few. Shailyn is pre-occupied. Perhaps<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> Grace knows someone?
(Hubbub of the Silver Crows arguing in camp)
<g id="g_grace_crossarms" priority="high" />Mordred. Son of Morgaine! I've heard plenty about him, and none of it good. And<g id="g_grace_headshakeno" /> now he's after some relics.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Smells like desperate weather ahead.<g id="g_grace_concerns" priority="high" /> Ah, I don't like that look. You love this, don't<g id="g_grace_goaway" /> you, working for free!
"Think of it as earning favor."
<g id="g_grace_sympathy" />Ah. Well. Wouldn't hurt for Morgaine to owe us a favor. And the relics- we could always sell them.
<g id="g_grace_throwarms" />Fine! We'll pull on this rope a bit longer, and pray it doesn't hang us.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> For now, seems we need an expert in magical fire.
Hear Skye's report on Varangian activity
Investigate the Varangian activity in Great Cleave
Looks like Skye was right. The village is overrun with Varangian soldiers.
Defeat the Frostbound Varangians
You hear someone cry out. There may be survivors.
Search the village for survivors
Talk to the survivor
Track down the Varangian commander
Several footprints lead up the hill above the village.
You hear some voices from the rocks above.
Investigate the voices
Confront the Varangian commander
Discuss Mordred's presence with Skye
Enter the caves to find why Mordred was there
Make your way deeper into the caves
A large ice dome stands before you. There seems to be an opening on one side.
Investigate the ice dome
Examine the pedestal
Mordred took whatever was here. It seems the item was round- maybe the "ring" the villager mentioned?
Search the cavern for clues
You spot a scrap of parchment out of the corner of your eye.
Read the crumpled note
Exit the cavern
Discuss the strange ice dome and Mordred's ring with Skye
Visit Mordred's old cabin to find out what he's up to
Search Mordred's cabin for clues about his plans
A fetid rot hits your nose. Amidst the debris is a letter on the table.
Read Mordred's letter
As you finish reading, someone enters the cabin.
Return to camp and tell Skye that Mordred is after the Frosted Crown of King Idris
Daichi Saito
Grace O'Malley wants to add more firepower to the team. Find Daichi Saito and recruit him to the Silver Crows.
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />I've been meaning to speak with you about the crew. Zander's-<g id="g_grace_no" /> well, he's a wall of muscle.
<g id="g_grace_convince2" />Rima's got great connections, she'll help us get better contracts. So I'm thinking, maybe we mix it up, add someone with-
I've been meaning to speak with you about the crew. When it comes to a fight, Zander's a wall of muscle.
Rima's quick with a blade, and you- you're deadly with that fire magic. So I'm thinking, let's add even more-
"-magical firepower?"
<g id="g_grace_proud" />Yeah, and literally, someone with magical fire. It’s a powerful element, I’m sure you’d agree.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Nothing better than fire to deal with those-<g id="g_grace_realize" /> what are they, Furious Trees. Or<g id="g_grace_flirt" /> burn our way into a castle full of treasure.
<g id="g_grace_proud" />Yeah, and literally, someone with magical fire. It’s a powerful element, I’m sure you’d agree.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Nothing better than fire to deal with those-<g id="g_grace_realize" /> what are they, Furious Trees. Or<g id="g_grace_flirt" /> burn our way into a castle full of treasure.
"I'll ask around."
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Good thinking. Actually, you may want to chat with Rima- she's got more friends than the rest of us put together.
<g id="g_grace_convince1" />Plus, it'll give her something to do, besides complain about the camp. It's<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" /> not half bad, if you ask me.
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Good thinking. Actually, you may want to chat with Rima what with her connections.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> And listen-

<g id="g_grace_greethead" priority="high" />Skye the Spear Daughter's another strong candidate I've been thinking about. She's a terrifying good fighter,<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> got a good heart-
"Bring her onboard."
<g id="g_grace_yes" />Glad to hear you say that! I<g id="g_grace_consider" /> didn't want to push too much as your First Mate but- good thing is, you and I seem to think alike.
<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" />I'll send word for her to join us.<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" /> I expect it'll take awhile to reach her in the mountains.
<g id="g_grace_spreadarms" />Always good to bring more hands on deck, but our coffers are getting a bit dusty.<g id="g_grace_no" /> Might need to trim our sails.
<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" />Hire some Ancient guardians- work long hours for a low<g id="g_grace_goaway" /> wage. Relax, I’m joking.<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" /> Do you think- nah.
<g id="g_litearmor_think" priority="high" />Fire magic, hm? Fire magic. There's Landry, but no, he's an idiot, really.<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> Sven, too talkative, also no.
<g id="g_female_pointthreaten" />Oh! Have I ever got the candidate for you! <g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />How does a ronin, turned warrior monk of a fire temple, strike your fancy?
"Samurai can do fire magic?"
<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Ex-samurai in this case, but well- on Aeternum,<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> haven't we all been given a fresh start?
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />Now if one's to believe the gossip, he may have the very strongest fire magic around. Something to do with<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> spiritual harmony?
"Sounds like he's in demand."
<g id="g_male_explain" />Well, that's just it- while others may want him, I hear he hasn't exactly been<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> open to offers.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />He's been spending time in the northeast of Shattered Mountain, if you'd care to give him a try.<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" bin="1" bout="1.5" /> Daichi Saito's his name.
This valley is full of darkness. It fills the mind with fear. My master would have- Ah, but that is in the past. We are all only shadows on the rocks.
Perhaps I need a sign which says, "Here is someone meditating. That is why they are kneeling with their eyes closed."
Since you have disturbed my battle, might I ask your help? This Enenra is- quite strong.
"I don't see you fighting."
Exactly! I cannot force the demon to appear. It is taking all of my energy to prevent it from escaping this valley.
If you will light the fire seals, that will trap it. Then I can draw it out and defeat it.
"So, just light some simple fires?"
No, we must follow the proper ritual. Build the fires with spirit wood, and light them in the correct sequence. Use the launchers. Here, this scroll.
It has the four patterns, and the order. Hurry! I do not know how much longer I can hold this beast.
(Daichi concentrates, his mind focused elsewhere. It doesn't seem as if he can speak to you at the moment.)

When asked how to properly form the seal, Fox replied with yet another question. "Which element endures? Rivers carve the earth. Fire needs air to breathe. Yet the wind throws itself in vain against stone walls."
(sharp intake of breath- Daichi senses the ghost and opens his eyes)
It's here.
(effort sound such as "hmm!" or "mph!"- as Daichi casts a fire net around the ghost to hold it)
(effort, gasping, shaking- as Daichi holds the struggling ghost in his net of magical fire)
(effort of Daichi's attack- he stands, parries a blow from the ghost, and swings upward with the naginata, slicing at it)
(Daichi breathing- as he stands stock still in his finishing pose from his strike)

string.comment: Daichi nods and grunts in approval at the player.
string.speaker: Daichi Saito
string.name: DaichiSaito

resources.string: Mm.

<g id="g_yonas_bowshallow" />Thank you for your help, Soulwarden.<g id="g_yonas_noddingheadapproval" /> Oh, I know who you are and why you are here. But I am<g id="g_yonas_headtilthmm" /> not willing to join your Silver Crows just yet.
<g id="g_yonas_shrug" />What I do not know is, are you someone I can respect as a leader?<g id="g_yonas_shh" /> I want a match with you.
"I’m ready whenever you are."
<g id="g_yonas_fistsmack" />Hm! "Quickness is the essence of war."<g id="g_yonas_headnodyes" /> I like the manner in which your mind works.
<g id="g_yonas_nodbig" />Follow me, then.<g id="g_yonas_lookbehind" /> Use my war fan. It will take you to the spirit shrine in<g id="g_yonas_noddingsubtle" /> my dojo.
If you think you may lose, you have already lost. The key is not to think at all, simply be.
They say the measure of a samurai is how resolute one is, in the acceptance of death.
But when death has no meaning, how can we measure a warrior's worth?
"We fight."
Ha ha ha! I like you more and more! Let us see if you live up to your confidence, and your fancy reputation.
The frog leaps in fire.
Well, you can fight. Let's see how you think.
Ah ha ha! You can take a little heat. Now, stand in the fire!
The song of wind.
It seems you Silver Crows are just talk, after all.

string.comment: Daichi grunts in pain at start of this- just defeated
string.speaker: Daichi Saito
string.name: DaichiSaito

resources.string: You- made me try. I will meet you at your Silver Crows camp.
Good. You do not waste energy.
Ha- hid your true strength, did you?
Not bad. But now I see your pattern!
Surviving a battle is not strength. Nor is falling before a superior enemy weakness.
With my defeat, destiny has changed. I ride the tail of a dragon who shapes the very earth. I will meet you back at your camp.
<g id="g_yonas_crossarmsshakehead" />Ah, so noisy here. To have the solitude of the mountains again.

<g id="g_yonas_gestureforward" />The one with the hat keeps telling me what to do.<g id="g_yonas_headtilthmm" /> Do they think I am weak because I lost our match?<g id="g_yonas_headshakedisappointed" /> To understimate me would be a grave mistake.
"Just- try to get along, okay?"
<g id="g_yonas_shrug" />I have no need to get along- it is you I follow, not them.
<g id="g_yonas_spreadarmsnod" />But, if it puts your mind at peace, I will tolerate their hand waving and<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" /> incessant, awkward, blathering.
(Dog seems absorbed by watching Daichi. It seems fairly likely that Daichi's been sneaking him treats.)

<g id="g_female_notsure" />Daichi? Well, he is very unpleasant. But<g id="g_female_youknow" /> in Greece we say, a true friend<g id="g_male_itsokay" /> shows their worth when you are standing in the muck.
<g id="g_male_agree1" />What does it matter if someone smiles at you if they run<g id="g_male_spreadhands" /> when it is time to fight?
<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" />Rock-headed, offensive- person!<g id="g_male_why" /> Yes, Daichi! I don't know if he's<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> actually making an effort to infuriate me?

<g id="g_female_touchhands" />"Young lady. Why do you not stop talking and<g id="g_litearmor_dismissgetlost2" /> go play with your little guitar?"<g id="g_female_yourecrazy" /> First of all, it is NOT A GUITAR!
<g id="g_grace_noway" />I'm not sure what's more unpleasant- having Daichi not listen to anyone, or hearing Rima complain about it.
<g id="g_grace_relief" />I almost wish she would complain about the camp again.
<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" />What do I think of Daichi?<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> He thinks he is better than everyone else.
<g id="g_female_notsure" />So he is like Rima, but with a better sense for dressing himself.<g id="g_male_laugh" /> Ha ha! Did<g id="g_female_leanforwardsmall" /> you hear that, Rima?
"You think he'll fit in?"
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Listen to me.<g id="g_male_itsokay" /> The best of the best, that is what you are<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> gathering here.

<g id="g_male_righthandnodeal" />There will always be trouble between the strong. That is<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> why we have you, to settle things.<g id="g_male_shocked" /> Ah! Rima! What<g id="g_female_clenchfistssuffer" /> did you put in my boots!
<g id="g_grace_flirt" />Well, congratulations on hiring Daichi. He's no doubt a powerful add to the team.<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" /> It's just-

<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />I wonder if you might have a word with him about that<g id="g_grace_headshakeno" /> attitude of his.<g id="g_grace_noway" priority="high" /> He won't listen to anything I say- calls me the "lady with the hat."
"You do wear a hat."
<g id="g_grace_frustrated" />So does Rima! All right, I admit, he probably just needs some time to fit in<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" /> with- anyone.

<g id="g_grace_concerns" priority="high" />But if things don't get better soon, then I say<g id="g_grace_fisthigh" /> we give him the heave-ho.<g id="g_grace_gesturer" /> Even Zander doesn't like him!
Ask Rima about potential fire mage candidates
Find the fire mage Daichi Saito
Introduce yourself to Daichi Saito
Read the scroll for instructions on the Trapping Seal
Gather spirit wood, then build the Trapping Seals in any order
Construct the Trapping Seals in any order
Spirit Wood
Build the Earth Seal
Build the Water Seal
Build the Fire Seal
Build the Wind Seal
Use the launchers to light the fire seals in the order depicted in Daichi's note
It seems you didn't light the seals in the correct order...
Launch the Rocket at the Water Seal
Launch the Rocket at the Earth Seal
Launch the Rocket at the Air Seal
Launch the Rocket at the Fire Seal
Let Daichi know the fires are lit
Use the war fan to enter Daichi's dojo
Defeat Daichi
Return to the Crow's Nest and get Daichi settled in with the team
Check with Zander on how the Crows are getting along with Daichi
The Ice Castle
Work with Daichi Saito to find a way into the legendary Ice Castle, and look for the Frost Crown.
<g id="g_grace_consider" />Let's see what our new recruit can do about getting us into that Ice Castle, so we can get the Frost Crown<g id="g_grace_gestureleftm" /> before Mordred.
<g id="g_grace_think" />Problem is, there's a lot of water between the shoreline and that island. We'll need a way across.
"We can search the coast."
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Good idea. Bound to find some small fishing or supply boats that way. I'll meet you on the island with the others.
Truth is,<g id="g_grace_no" /> I'm tired of paperwork. And I'm<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" /> more than a bit curious to see Saito's wizardry.
<g id="g_grace_lean" />Let’s keep an eye out for any interesting items in that Ice Castle. I’m certainly not hoping for any<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> rewards from mad King Idris.
(Dog seems comfortable in the extreme cold. He might actually be enjoying it.)
<g id="g_male_waghand01" />I thought I knew cold weather. I have seen<g id="g_female_shrugshort" /> plenty of ice before. But there is<g id="g_male_think" /> something- wrong, about this place.
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />As if Beira herself had a hand in its making. Or worse, the Hag.<g id="g_female_sighrelief" /> It sends a chill through me.
<g id="g_female_lookaroundconfused" priority="high" />This place is truly a wonder. Can you imagine the tragic story of the people who once lived here?
<g id="g_male_handheart" />The Lament of Idris. "<g id="g_male_spreadhands" />Then came the killing frost, and all their hope was lost.<g id="g_female_spreadarms" /> All their hope was lost."
<g id="g_yonas_explain01" />It is narrow of mind to think this way! The purple one, Zander, the lady with the hat, all of them speak as if fire and ice were opposite!
<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" />They are more alike than different.<g id="g_yonas_waghanddisagree02" priority="high" /> Ice is not alive? Everything has life!

<g id="g_female_waveoffdisdain" />Ah, listen to me, we are wasting our time here.<g id="g_male_agree1" /> That wall, it is solid ice, very very thick!<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> Granny Pike used to say to me-

<g id="g_male_compliment" />"Zander, do not fight a rat with only your mouth.<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> Unless it is dead."<g id="g_male_laughbig" /> Ha ha ha!<g id="g_female_youknow" /> She is so funny.
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />I’ve always thought, if you can’t change your cards, you<g id="g_grace_gestureleftm" /> change the way you play them.

<g id="g_grace_disapprove" />But I’m not sure the people that lived here had much of a choice either way. And if<g id="g_grace_dismiss2" priority="high" /> Mordred gets his way, we’re all in the soup.
"Aren't you a vegetarian?"
"Can you melt it?"

string.comment: Merged line used to generate lip sync on merged audio
string.speaker: Zander
string.name: ZanderTheUndying

resources.string: I am telling you, it is hopeless! The gate is solid ice. I used all my strength and could not make a single scratch. There is nothing- that can get through it. I weakened it for him. Pretty sure I saw cracks in the ice after I struck it.

string.comment: Zander talks to the player outside of an ice castle, where the gate is filled with ice that cannot be broken
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: I am telling you, it is hopeless! The gate is solid ice.
I used all my strength and could not make a single scratch. There is nothing-

string.comment: Zander finishes his sentence just after Daichi slashes right through the ice.
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: -that can get through it.
I weakened it for him.

string.comment: Zander says this as he follows Skye through the open gate off camera, trying to convince her.
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Pretty sure I saw cracks in the ice after I struck it.

<g id="g_male_pointblame" />You know, I still say I loosened up that wall. I am<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> telling you, when something cracks many times, the cracks become<g id="g_female_notsure" /> very small and looks like what? Ice.
<g id="g_female_rightfistthreaten" />I hear the snorting sounds coming from your nose, Rima,<g id="g_male_shakehead" /> and it is not helpful!

<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />I suppose it’s true that life has a balance. That<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> insufferable man with a heart of cold iron who could not make a friend if his life depended on it, also happens to have<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> incredibly powerful fire magic.
<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" />Daichi may be full of contradictions.

<g id="g_female_headnodding" />I have seen such pieces before.<g id="g_male_rememberbig" priority="high" /> No, I have fought them! An ogre, an occultist-<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> yes, they are fashioned after the Corrupted.
<g id="g_female_lookforwardwonder" />What skillful magic imbues this place. A wonder to revel in, were there not such evil at play.
<g id="g_male_nod2" />Ah, this is exciting! Chess! A king's game. I have played<g id="g_female_waverightnoway" /> many, many times in Greece.
<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" />Why are you looking at me that way? It is the truth,<g id="g_male_agree1" /> I am something like an expert in this game!
<g id="g_yonas_crossarmsshakehead" />These games. Shogi, chess, chaturanga, they were wrong to make them. People think that playing will make them smart.
<g id="g_yonas_onehandoutnoway" />No. The mind then becomes master to the spirit. Living in the future, never in the now.

<g id="g_female_notsure" />Do I play chess? Do<g id="g_male_itsokay" /> squirrels not taste of chicken?<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> Wait. That is-<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> not. True. Anyway!<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> Look at this board- the ogre is a rook.
<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" />The spearmen are pawns, the Corrupted priest is a bishop, the elk is a knight,<g id="g_male_pointblame" /> and the maiden, a queen.
"Any tips?"
<g id="g_female_fingerwagno" />Do not visit Brimstone Sands in the summer!<g id="g_male_laughbig" /> Ha ha ha! But listen,<g id="g_male_righthandnodeal" /> in chess, as in life, take what you want!

<g id="g_male_think" />Oh. That gem on the enemy king. I<g id="g_female_youknow" /> think it can fit into that pedestal by the exit, and maybe<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> unlock the door.<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> Opa!
<g id="g_male_handshipsdisapprove" />Who would do such a thing? To freeze someone in such a way, and kill them, is wrong. But to<g id="g_female_disagreerighthandout" /> do this on Aeternum.
<g id="g_female_gestureforward01" />These people will die forever.<g id="g_female_crossarms" /> Ah, this kind of cruelty fills me with such an anger.
<g id="g_male_itsokay" />I would like to have a long talk with the one who is freezing people this way.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />And by "long talk" I mean, not talking with words, but<g id="g_female_fingerwagno" /> instead, punching them very hard.
<g id="g_yonas_shrug" />Why? Why do a thing such as this?<g id="g_yonas_explain01" /> Fire and ice, they are not just tools. They shape those who wield them.
<g id="g_yonas_gesturearound" priority="high" />In this place, frost has carved a darkness into the heart of this castle, and its lord.

<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" />I know what you would ask but I cannot free them. This is a<g id="g_yonas_gesturebothhands" /> powerful, old magic. The cold-<g id="g_yonas_gestureforward" priority="high" /> it has seeped like a poison into their souls.
<g id="g_yonas_handsextendedsorry" />Like the fangs of a snake. Pulling them out may harm them in even a worse manner.
"I won't leave them like this."
<g id="g_yonas_headshakeno" />So be it.<g id="g_yonas_giveitem" /> I will give you a special fire charm- an ofuda.<g id="g_yonas_noddingsubtle" /> I believe you have the ability to use it.
<g id="g_yonas_shakeheadworried" priority="high" />You may be able to release them. But, should you fail- I cannot speak of such horror.

string.comment: No recording needed, this will be text.
string.speaker: Elsa Persson
string.name: ElsaPersson

resources.string: (You could swear that the statue's eyes are following your movement.)
What a fool I was, to seek out the mysteries of a mad king!
I've had decades to think on it, and I've decided. I'll be moving to Brimstone Sands! Oh, what I wouldn't give for a nice, painful, sunburn!

string.comment: No recording needed, this will be text.
string.speaker: Shen Mao
string.name: ShenMao

resources.string: (As if in response to your voice, you detect the faintest hint of movement.)
Augh! Thank the gods for sending you! That foul King Idris! If only I hadn't needed the coin, I'd have never signed up.
We all knew something was wrong, worse by the day, eating away at him- you could see it in his eyes!

<g id="g_yonas_explain02" />I would not believe it, had I not seen it! You<g id="g_yonas_righthand02" /> attuned yourself to the fire charm, more<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" /> perfectly than even I could have.
<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" />Are you some trickster god come to humble me?<g id="g_yonas_shrugdontcare" priority="high" /> If so, I do not feel bad for losing our match.
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />Just when I think I stopped being surprised by your abilities! You really<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> do live up to your name.
<g id="g_male_compliment" />The joy, the relief these poor prisoners must feel, all<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> thanks to you.
"They'll need help to escape."
<g id="g_male_willcoverit" />And you may rely on us. We'll be sure they make<g id="g_male_headnodyes" /> free of this cursed place.

<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" />Strength to your arm. And deliver a firm "message" from us to that<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> vile King Idris-<g id="g_female_smackfist" priority="high" /> as you knock the Frost Crown from his head.
Stolen! Stolen, and you- you're with him!
Come to take what belongs to King Idris? Think us weak without the Crown? We will show you true might!
Bare your neck to the snap of Frost!
Come, join my Garden of Ice!
Let all know the might of King Idris!
The Frost Crown was nothing! It is our might! Our might! That won this day.
Thieves! You will win no words of regret from these lips!
Nothing- nothing! Without the power of Frost.
Forgotten by all. Is that- our fate?
That thieving whelp! Took the Frost Crown! A thousand curses! May it break him as it has tormented us.
That thieving whelp! Took the Frost Crown! A thousand curses!
May it break him as it has tormented us.
If I lend my hand, I give my son exactly what he wants and make things even worse. So I'll put my trust in you and whatever gods might be listening.
Mordred took the crown from Idris? That makes my news all the worse. My fool son has indeed gotten into my research.
There were once Ancients, evil ones, who sought ways to imbue mortals with power akin to their own.
"Mordred wants to become a god?"
Yes. A god of winter. To do this, he needs a ternion- the ring, the crown, and the Staff of Samhain.
Binding them with the Winter Rune would make him into a monster, and unleash calamity upon the world. An eternal frost.
"We must find the staff and rune-"
-Before Mordred does. But your "we" must exclude me. He would not listen to reason were I to join you.
The rune and the chamber are lost to legend, but I will light your path to the staff and the mage who found it.
(Dog digs his claws into the wood beneath him. He seems worried. It makes you wonder just how aware he is of what's going on.)
<g id="g_grace_no" />An endless age of ice, Ancient magics, an evil knight and his<g id="g_grace_gesturelefts" /> powerful toys.
<g id="g_grace_noway" priority="high" />If I weren't the woman of action that I am, I'd be inclined to duck into my tent and hide my head under the covers.

<g id="g_grace_shrugdontknow" />All things considered, a<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" /> job well done. But<g id="g_grace_concerns" priority="high" /> make no mistake, we’re deep in the pickle brine now.
<g id="g_grace_worry" />We mess this up, and there'll be an unwelcome visitor having a nice long stay with us.<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> And its name is Winter.
Select a chess piece
Choose your move
Select Rook
Move to E5
Get to the Island of Frost before Mordred does
The island is faintly visible from shore. You might use one of these boats to reach it.
Use a boat to reach the Island of Frost
Talk to Zander at the Frost Gate
Ask Daichi if he can burn a hole through the gate
Talk to Zander at the Frost Gate
Search for a way into the castle keep to find the Frost Crown
Defeat the Lost servants of King Idris for a key to his inner keep
Enter the inner keep to search for King Idris and the Frost Crown
Zander is muttering loudly about chess- maybe he has an idea about this room.
Solve the chess endgame to win the exit gem
The wrong move was made. Resetting the board...
The board resets. Perhaps you made the wrong move?
Recover the gem that fell from the King chess piece
Place the gem on the pedestal to unlock the door
Search the castle for King Idris and the Frost Crown
Before you is a gruesome sight- statues of frozen humans. Only two show faint signs of life.
Ask Daichi if he can free the frozen prisoners
Free the frozen prisoners
Rescue the captured explorer
Rescue the imprisoned soldier
Talk to Skye about escorting the prisoners to safety
Enter the Throne Room to look for King Idris and the Frost Crown
Defeat King Idris
Continue to search for the Frost Crown
Return to the castle gate to let the others know that Mordred has the crown
Ask Morgaine what she's found about Mordred's plans
Discuss Morgaine's findings with the others
Read the journal entry from King Idris
The Mage
Morgaine spoke of a mage who obtained the Staff of Samhain, the final artifact needed to empower Mordred and bring on an endless winter. Get the staff from the mage before Mordred does.
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />Seems if we stop Mordred, we stop the forever winter. So we<g id="g_grace_realize" /> need to get the Staff of Samhain, and the Winter Rune, before he does.
<g id="g_grace_concerns" />But we've been drinking from his wake. We need to<g id="g_grace_smackfist" priority="high" /> get ahead of him, catch some clear wind.
"Let's split the team up."
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Great idea. That way we've got a better chance of getting either the rune or the staff.
<g id="g_grace_realize" />We know where the staff is- maybe you can take a team after that? The<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" /> rest of us will look into the rune, figure out where it is.
"I'll take Rima and Skye."
<g id="g_grace_yes" />Brains and brawn, eh? Sounds like a plan.<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" /> Rima's got a good head for legends and such.
<g id="g_grace_greethead" />May want to check if she knows anything else about Mordred that could help,<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> in case you run into him.
<g id="g_grace_sorry" />We'll let you know what we find out about the Winter Rune. Ah, it might be time to start<g id="g_grace_no" /> fortifying the camp.
<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" />If we get ahold of either the staff or the rune, there's<g id="g_grace_spreadarms" /> nothing left for Mordred to do except come after us.
<g id="g_litearmor_think" />There's something Morgaine said about Mordred, that's been pulling at my sleeve.<g id="g_litearmor_realize" /> That letter he wrote to Artorius.
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Doesn't it sound like someone trying to work out their feelings?<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" /> He's like- a hurt child.
"So the key to this is Artorius."

<g id="g_male_pointblame" />Exactly. Mordred's ego was crushed. If we heal that injury, perhaps all of this<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> goes away.<g id="g_litearmor_tiltheadremember" priority="high" /> Oh- Ebonscale Reach!
<g id="g_litearmor_secretiveshort" />There's a scholar I know, he was a senior scribe at Prydwen.<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> He can help us find proof of the King's intentions.
<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" />I spent some time there in my wandering youth.<g id="g_female_flirtsmall" /> "Oh Ebonscale, heads or tails-"
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />Ah, it was a brighter place once, despite the challenges. I once knew a fair lass- but,<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> that's a tale for another day.
The Staff of Samhain? Yes, it was recovered by a mage. His name is Jehan Pelerin.
He was also very interested in the Ancients - it was the constructs that intrigued him. But I haven't heard from him in a very long time.
Oh! You’re from the Silver Crows interviews! I'm- still waiting for a response. Oh yes, King Artorius and Mordred.
Prior to coming here to study the Ancients, I spent years as a scribe in Prydwen, managing their records.
"Anything about a falling out?"
Well, that is amusing! You might say it was a continual falling out. But there is something-
Yes, in the King’s journal, now I remember, it was just after Mordred had been banished. It should be in these scrolls.

It was pride, Gwynn. My pride. Yes, in equal part, the lad's incessant prodding. His sharp, bottomless ambition. And in that moment, too painful a reminder. Of my own failures as King- nay, as a man. On the morrow I'll send word. Mordred still carries a seat at our table, such as is left of it.
It was pride, Gwynn. My pride. Yes, in equal part, the lad's incessant prodding. His sharp, bottomless ambition.
And in that moment, too painful a reminder. Of my own failures as King- nay, as a man.
On the morrow I'll send word. Mordred still carries a seat at our table, such as is left of it.

<g id="g_litearmor_headshakeno" />That was- surprisingly sad.<g id="g_litearmor_converseright" /> And tragic that word never reached Mordred.<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> I suppose the King disappeared before it was sent.
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />But this is exactly what we were looking for! Artorius felt<g id="g_litearmor_nodunderstand" /> terrible for what he'd done.
"This may not be enough."
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />You have a good point. Pride and anger,<g id="g_male_waghand02" /> once in motion, is hard to recover from.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />But we must try, if there's even a hint of a chance!<g id="g_litearmor_agree1" /> These feelings from Artorius may yet reach Mordred-<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> I'm sure they will.
<g id="g_female_spreadarms" />I've heard tales of King Artorius, of course- but to<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> read that letter. It was so heartfelt.

<g id="g_litearmor_headshakeno" />I wish I could have met him.<g id="g_female_youknows" /> I picture him with a beard, don't you?<g id="g_female_laughmed" /> A bit unkempt, bits of dried ale in it. I'm joking!

<g id="g_female_handsonhipsshakeheads" />It is unsettling, what Morgaine told you. An<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> eternal winter that would destroy all life. A<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> cold without end. It is<g id="g_female_youknow" /> not possible to imagine such a thing.
(Dog's tufted ears flicker, perhaps turning toward sounds he hears nearby.)

<g id="g_male_headnodyes" />There you are! Rima's<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> gone ahead with Dog. They<g id="g_female_youknows" /> seek a way in to find the Staff. I will<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> stay to guard the approach.
"Any sign of Mordred?
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />None, though he may have gone<g id="g_male_pointblame" /> before. Be wary, for serpents and madmen strike without warning.

<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" />Rima thinks we should- what was it- appeal to Mordred's heart.<g id="g_female_crossarms" /> Oh, I want to appeal to his heart. With<g id="g_female_smackfist" priority="high" /> the point of my spear.
(Dog seems quite interested in the wall, for some reason. Perhaps he saw a rat.)
<g id="g_female_lookaroundconfused" priority="high" />It seems this place was once a grand affair.
<g id="g_litearmor_think" />Some kind of hidden temple. Perhaps the mage we're looking for found the Staff here, then<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> loved it so much he decided to stay.
"Speaking of moving in."
<g id="g_litearmor_hopeless" />Yes, well, I can't get through. As Zander might say,<g id="g_litearmor_crossarmsupset" /> "Door. Thick like my skull.<g id="g_male_ragepunchfistsdown" /> Cannot break."
<g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />I've pushed, pulled, yelled phrases at it, some colorful ones as well, and-<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> Say, did you just hear Dog caterwauling?
<g id="g_female_explains" />If we do find Mordred here, we need to think on how to convey what we've found.<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> One thing's for certain, let's not mention Morgaine.
<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" />Seems they don't have a very good relationship.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" /> Boys and their mothers.
(Dog meows loudly to draw the player's attention)
(Dog seems to be calling your attention to a crumbled section of wall that he's standing next to.)
"You want to get through there?"
(Dog meows affirmatively. He seems happy that you've understood!)
(Dog flickers his ears, focused on the crumbled section of wall. He seems to be waiting for you to do something.)
Whatever you did, I think it's open!
Rima: Whatever you did, I think it's open!
(Dog's ears are laid back slightly. He doesn't like the feeling of this cave, for some reason.)
I thought myself rid of you, but now I see that you're like a village mongrel. Noxious, foul-tempered, sniffing my tracks like a thieving cur.
<g id="g_female_nodconsider" />Something's bothering me about this whole mess. I've the feeling that-
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />It may sound odd, but I've the uncanny feeling that Mordred's being used by some-<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> other power.
What. A letter from Artorius? Let me see. Oh, how easy for him. To banish me in one breath, and in the next, offer a seat back at his table.
Am I then a cur cast into the cold, only to limp back, mewling for milk?
"He loved you."
He loved himself! How kingly of him to forgive! After ruining my life on a whim, because I piqued his temper.
So yes, it is proof. Proof I was never more than a fly to him. All the more reason to tear down everything he loved!
<g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />I am so sorry. Not only did my idea not work, it’s provoked him even further.<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> Save me from the vanity of men! Er, knights.
<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" />We'd best get after him.<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> I don’t like to think what'll happen if he gets the staff first.
"Let Skye know what’s going on."
<g id="g_litearmor_nodunderstand" />Good thinking. Skye and I can watch for Mordred,<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> in the event he tries to escape with the staff.
<g id="g_litearmor_realize" />And oh, I almost forgot, this map- I, um, borrowed it from him as we talked.<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> It may be worth a look.
Yes? Oh, you expected something witty? Sinister? Something that rhymes? I'm a magic door, not a poet!
Go thou forth and find the glorious word of passing, so I may goest back to my nap. Tinkle glitter magic sounds, the end.
Brain bird, goat curd, do you have the pass word? If you don't, then I suggest you look, through Jehan's notes, from Jehan's books.
Oh, I do hate rhyming. Anyway, speak the secret phrase or you shall not pass.
"You let Mordred through."
You mean Ser Loves-Himself? No helping it, he threatened to burn a hole through me if I didn't let him through.
I jest. He spoke the pass word before you arrived. Now go! Find the phrase, and you will amaze!
I have not slept since the Staff came into my possession. It was buried here, hidden, protected by powerful magic, I found. I- cannot think well.
I awoke, staring at the Staff. Eyes full of sand, legs afire, as if I'd been squatting in front of it for days. Have I been? In and out the door. "Nevermore. Nevermore."
The cold, the endless cold. No, not the fault of the Staff. The fault lies in this frail body. Yes. the constructs. So perfect. Clean. If only I could- be one. Yes.
At last, I will rid myself of it. Of this dirty, weak shell. It itches. This disgusting human skin. I will rid myself of it and finally, ascend to freedom. How glorious.
Took you long enough. I could have baked a pie, it took so long. Of course I don't bake, I'm a magic door!
Well? Do you have the phrase, or must I keep talking for an Aeternum? Did you like that?
"The phrase is 'nevermore.'"
Aww, pish! Boring. You have bored me with your password finding skills. Why don't you go become a scribe.
I'll unlock the door now. If you miss me, ask Jehan to make me on your own door. Goodbye.
Mordred: Huh.

string.comment: Mordred reels back and punches the barrier
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Mordred: Hmph- Ah!

string.comment: Mordred blasts fire at the barrier
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Mordred: Hah!

string.comment: Mordred pounds at his own head in frustration
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Mordred: No, no, no!

string.comment: Mordred reaches out at the barrier
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Mordred: Maybe…

string.comment: Mordred gets shocked and knocked back a step by the barrier
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Mordred: Ohh!

string.comment: Mordred shoots flame in frustration at the barrier
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Mordred: HRAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!
Mordred: Hm. Hm hm.

string.comment: Mordred reacts as the barrier around the staff disappears
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Yes! The mage's death. The barrier is gone! Nothing can stop me now, Artorius!

string.comment: Mordred reacts as the barrier around the staff disappears
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Yes! The mage's death. The barrier is gone!
Nothing can stop me now, Artorius!
That one told me. You've come to take the Staff. You must not! You will not!
Humanity. The stench of it!
The Staff calls to me. The Staff guides me!
I found the Staff! It is mine! Mine!
I won't go back. I cannot go back!
At last, the stink is purged.
Ha ha ha! You see! The weakness of your frame.
I see. I was- wrong. The Staff. Take it!
<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" />Worse and worse. This is a tale told at night, with horror enough to shake the strong.<g id="g_litearmor_darnit" /> We had him in front of us!
<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Skye was right. There was no sense in my appealing to his<g id="g_litearmor_dismissgetlost2" /> humanity, as he has none left!
<g id="g_male_dontknow" />We haven't seen Mordred! But<g id="g_male_darnit" /> he has the staff now, as well? Then<g id="g_male_agree1" /> there's little time to waste, and none for parley.
<g id="g_male_righthandnodeal" />Little men like him will only listen to cold iron,<g id="g_female_notsure" /> preferably stuck through their tiny hearts.
"There's still the Rune."
<g id="g_female_nodyes" />Yes, the Winter Rune, Morgaine called it. Let's<g id="g_male_spreadhands" /> return to the others and see what they've learned.

<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" />I only hope we still have time to stop him, but<g id="g_male_nodunderstand" /> I trust you Soulwarden. Let us<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> put an end to this together.

<g id="g_grace_upset" priority="high" />Cat's curse. Mordred's got everything he needs to turn us all into icicles, save the rune. We'll<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" /> need to move fast.<g id="g_grace_shrugdontknow" /> Brr. Is<g id="g_grace_cantremember" priority="high" /> it just me, or did it get colder here, all of a sudden?
Ask Rima for her thoughts on stopping Mordred
Travel to Ebonscale Reach to ask a Prydwen scholar for information that could curb Mordred's ambitions
Ask the scholar about the relationship between Artorius and Mordred
Read the journal entry from Artorius
Travel to the hills of Ebonscale Reach to look for Mordred and the Staff of Samhain
Ask Skye if she's seen Rima or Mordred
Look for an entrance into the caves to search for the Staff
Select the correct combination of door symbols to unlock the cavern entrance
Examine the map that Rima "borrowed" from Mordred
Unlock the entrance to the inner caverns
Enter the inner caverns to search for the Staff
Continue your search for Mordred and the Staff of Samhain
Continue your search for Mordred and the Staff of Samhain
Talk to Rima
Break the wall
See if Dog can do something about the door
(CLUNK.)
Continue your search for the mage and the Staff of Samhain
Try to reason with Mordred
Something seems to be moving, on the right side of the doorway.
Talk to the head that appeared to the right of the doorway
Search Jehan's notes for the door's pass phrase
Tell the magic door the pass phrase and pursue Mordred
Defeat Jehan and find a way to reach the Staff of Samhain
Mordred is at the far end of the cavern, trying to retrieve the Staff
Go after Mordred
Look for a way to reach Mordred and the Staff
Exit the caves to look for Mordred and the Staff
Return to camp to tell the others that Mordred has all three artifacts
(Dog seems anxious and upset, unlike his usual relaxed self.)
The Winter Rune
Get the Winter Rune that binds the three winter artifacts together, before Mordred gets to it.

<g id="g_grace_yes" />Our visit to the library in Brimstone paid off.<g id="g_grace_headtilthmm" /> Turns out there was a forge where the<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> Ancients smithied runes of power.
<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" />It's there they locked away the Winter Rune, thought it was too dangerous.<g id="g_grace_realize" /> Guess where this Rune Forge is?
"Great Cleave."
Great Cleave-<g id="g_grace_relief" /> what? Don't tell me you just guessed that. All right, don't<g id="g_grace_dismiss2" priority="high" /> make a display of yourself.

<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />At first I thought the map you got from Mordred might be<g id="g_grace_disappointed" priority="high" /> for the Winter Rune, but there are no waterfalls by the Forge.
"Could be that god-making temple."
<g id="g_grace_headnodyes" />Then let's hope we don't need it.<g id="g_grace_chastise" /> I don't fancy getting a clear view of Mordred turning into a monster.
<g id="g_grace_yes" />Take who you need to the Forge.<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" /> Skye and I'll find Morgaine.<g id="g_grace_handheart" /> Maybe she'll change her mind about helping us.
<g id="g_grace_convince1" />Just when things were getting quiet again. I knew I couldn't trust it. Why can't we have a nice, fat, boring,<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" /> purse-fattening contract?
<g id="g_male_pointblame" />You know, I thought they were saying "ruin" and not "rune" this whole time. You know,<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" /> sometimes I think the gods tricked us.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />Giving us language-<g id="g_male_agree1" /> "Here! A nice new present!" But what did it do? It made us forget.<g id="g_male_itsokay" /> Forget how to really communicate.

This Mordred-<g id="g_yonas_explain01" /> he does not know it, but something cold, hungry, a terror- it breaks free of its tether, in a place that<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" /> shadows our world.
<g id="g_yonas_gesturebothhands" />We must stop him. The<g id="g_yonas_concerns" /> weakness of humanity- it will bring ruin on us all.
<g id="g_litearmor_worry" priority="high" />This is not good. Not good at all, if Mordred has all three artifacts.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />Can you imagine what that madman would do with the power of a god?<g id="g_litearmor_shakehead" /> I can- he'd strip our world of life. We<g id="g_litearmor_headshakeno" /> must hurry.

<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" />I wish I could go, but Grace is right. I'll be of<g id="g_female_headnodding" /> more use to you looking for Morgaine. That sorceress<g id="g_female_smackfist" priority="high" /> needs to leash her evil spawn.

And- should you<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> find Mordred first.<g id="g_female_disagreerighthandout" /> Don't sacrifice yourself to stop him.<g id="g_male_pleadhandsopen" /> There is much evil in the world, but only one of you.
<g id="g_grace_disapprove" />Och, and now Mordred has the rune as well? I was so sure we'd be able to take his sails.
<g id="g_grace_understand" />Well, you and I have made it through tougher weather than this.<g id="g_grace_crossarms" priority="high" /> Just not a never-ending winter kind of weather.
"I have the Rune."

<g id="g_female_crossarms" />I wish we could celebrate your success, but there is no time.<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> Earlier we saw Mordred and his men<g id="g_female_youknows" /> escape from where you came out.
<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" />It looked like he carried the Rune.<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" priority="high" /> We chased after, but lost them in the forest.
Travel to the Rune Forge to find the Winter Rune and forestall Mordred
Placeholder timer: Enter the Rune Forge, and defeat the Forge Boss
Enter the Rune Forge and get the Winter Rune before Mordred does
Defeat the Forge Guardian to recover the Winter Rune
Look for the Winter Rune needed to thwart Mordred
Collect the Winter Rune
Eternal Frost
Mordred has everything he needs to activate the Ancient device and become a winter demigod. Stop him before he brings about an Ice Age to Aeternum, and the rest of the world.
<g id="g_yonas_thinking" />I guess he is going to Mokosh Springs. For the what is it,<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" /> ritual chamber.<g id="g_yonas_headtilthmm" /> Why is your face looking like that?
<g id="g_yonas_gestureleftm" />The map you got from Mordred, the one with the<g id="g_yonas_gesturerights" /> three waterfalls.<g id="g_yonas_nodbig" /> This must be where he is going.
"The map is Mokosh Springs?"
<g id="g_yonas_shrug" />I thought everyone already knew this. The<g id="g_yonas_lefthand" /> waterfalls, the mountain shape-<g id="g_yonas_gesturebothhands" /> Mokosh.
"Help Grace find Morgaine."

<g id="g_yonas_noddingsubtle" />Yes, I can help talk sense to her. If she<g id="g_yonas_headshakedisappointed" /> knows how close her son is to turning us into ice sculptures,<g id="g_yonas_gesturerightm" /> she may change her mind.
<g id="g_yonas_noddingheadapproval" />Skye may know a way to find Morgaine. You know, I like Skye very much.
(Dog seems somewhat more at ease than before. Perhaps he was worried if you would make it across the cliffs safely.)

<g id="g_yonas_shiftawkward" />No, I am fine. It is this place, not the cold.<g id="g_yonas_lookleftdown" priority="high" /> There is something underneath- coming for us.<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" /> No. It is waiting for us.

<g id="g_yonas_lookdownconfused" priority="high" />It is- inhuman. Like a spider. And Mordred may be the unsuspecting moth. Or<g id="g_yonas_shrugdontcare" priority="high" /> worse, he is an anchor for the web.

How much<g id="g_litearmor_chuckle" /> f-further? I've fallen twenty times on this miserable path. You'd<g id="g_male_leanforwardinspect" /> think DAICHI WOULD LEND A HAND!<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> Damned mountain goat.
<g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />Well if I thought it was a bit drafty in the Crow's Nest, I've changed my mind completely.

Three artifacts for the ritual, yes, but also three runes to gain access! I feel your hand at play Artorius, but destiny is on my side. I will find the other two- they must be here. Oh, how the world will shake at my ascendance!
Three artifacts for the ritual, yes, but also three runes to gain access!
I feel your hand at play Artorius, but destiny is on my side.
I will find the other two- they must be here. Oh, how the world will shake at my ascendance!
<g id="g_yonas_takeitem8s" priority="high" />Hm- key runes. This note shows places they have searched. They needed three to enter, for the ritual!

<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" />These Ancient words- the rune names. Ascend. And-<g id="g_yonas_headtilthmm" /> Night? No- Fear. The last rune, we<g id="g_yonas_gesturelefts" /> have this one. The<g id="g_yonas_gesturebothhands" /> rune of Winter.
"We need two more runes to get in."
Yes.<g id="g_yonas_giveitem" /> I use "yami" orbs to store kanji seals- we can<g id="g_yonas_nodslight" /> use them to capture any runes we find.
The question is,<g id="g_yonas_shrug" /> where are they? There are<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" /> places marked closer to the entrance, that they did not check.
"I'll look around here."
<g id="g_yonas_nod" />Yes- let us split our efforts.<g id="g_yonas_noddingsubtle" /> I will search together with Rima, toward the entrance.
Ah-<g id="g_yonas_pointforwardthreaten" /> that telescope! It is pointing to the area below.<g id="g_yonas_headtilthmm" /> Perhaps they found a rune down there.
<g id="g_yonas_shakeheadworried" priority="high" />How many secrets are buried here? I can feel the lives taken- the suffering.
<g id="g_yonas_crossarmsshakehead" />I once was like the Mordred. For me, strength was everything. I see clearly now, my foolishness.
<g id="g_litearmor_chuckle" />Brr. The sooner we stop M-Mordred, the b-better.

<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" />Ah! If my fingers freeze and I can't play anymore, it'll<g id="g_female_pointthreaten" /> be on you to feed and- and bathe me! All my kingdom for<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> a hot bath!
(Dog stands vigilant. There's steel in his eyes. But, what kind of damage could such a small creature possibly do?)
The<g id="g_yonas_gestureleft" priority="high"/> temple entrance is behind the waterfall. It will open to you,<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" /> now that you have the three key runes.
<g id="g_yonas_handsextendedsorry" />Although, it is said that only a fool steps into shadows without a candle. Yes, I am saying we<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" /> are not ready.
"Speed is the essence of war."
<g id="g_yonas_laughcocky" priority="high" />Hahaha! Yes. And the more time I spend with you, the more I am convinced. I think perhaps<g id="g_yonas_shrug" /> you, at least, are always ready.
<g id="g_yonas_explain02" />Ah! Damn this cold weather. Making me say embarrassing things, like the purple singer.
(Dog makes a strange purring noise as if he's trying to say something. He taps a forepaw on the crate.)
"Oh- you want to stay here?"
(Dog meows and puffs out his chest. It seems he plans to stay and guard your way out.)

<g id="g_yonas_lookleftpensive" priority="high" />The magic here- there is great power. The ritual chamber is near.<g id="g_yonas_noddingheadapproval" /> Be ready. Be wary. Something very old watches, waits.
<g id="g_yonas_shakeheadworried" />It is very strong. And not of this world, I know it now. We must stop Mordred, it is the only way.
<g id="g_male_lookuparound" priority="high" />How odd to find such lovely art a place as cold and evil as this one.
Do you know,<g id="g_litearmor_willcoverit" /> I once discovered an amazing wood carving inside of a Roman cesspit?<g id="g_male_waghand01" /> Oh no, that's bringing back some bad memories.

<g id="g_female_lookaroundconfused" priority="high" />It must be close by. The energy here- so cold, foreign. I can absolutely believe this is where the Ancients made<g id="g_litearmor_headshakeno" /> monsters out of people.
And they weren't small, based on the ceilings<g id="g_litearmor_gestureforwardrighthand" /> and size of these door guardians.
"The statues seem familiar."

<g id="g_litearmor_realize" />Yes, you're right!<g id="g_female_lookbehind" priority="high" /> I think I saw the same lizards in the last room. How strange to find such art here.<g id="g_litearmor_lifthandsxs" /> Such detail.
Look.<g id="g_female_leanforwardsmall" /> The base of the statues- I believe they can rotate.<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" priority="high" /> Odd. Who'd bother turning them?

string.comment: Mordred slams staff into the arena floor with "might"
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Ancients! Grant me your power! Let all crack and bend before my- might!

string.comment: power flows into Mordred, transforming him
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Hahaha- Yes.
YES!
The fury of the gods, within me!
Ancients! Show your power!
Praise your good fortune, to behold my newfound might!
I feel- alive!
Taste the full might of Winter!
Artorius! Behold my power!
Feel the might of Frost!
Such power! Such might at my command!
At last you find your place. At my feet.
Know your place, hedge-born.
Truly laughable. Did you really think this would stop me?
Sad little fool. Your meddling has ended.
No! Fool! What have you done!
Artorius! I have not failed! I will not!
More! Give me more power!

string.comment: tendrils lash out at him from the rune, and flash freeze him
string.speaker: Mordred
string.name: Mordred

resources.string: Ah- ah- no- NOOOO!
<g id="g_male_righthandnodeal" />A good riddance to that foul knight! And his<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" /> twisted plan for a never-ending winter.

<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" />But you! I'm<g id="g_female_headnodding" /> glad I placed my trust in you. You've saved us.<g id="g_male_compliment" /> If I had just a portion of your strength, your will.

<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" />Well done. No,<g id="g_yonas_handsextendedsorry" /> I do not look down on you! Does "well done" sound that way to you? I do not know why I always offend those I respect.<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" /> It is troubling.
<g id="g_male_compliment" />My friend, you've done it! I can't-<g id="g_litearmor_willcoverit" /> what an immense relief, it's nothing short of amazing you were able to stop him!
<g id="g_female_notsure" />But you say Mordred froze? I suppose we can't leave him like that, horrible as he is. Or-<g id="g_litearmor_headtilthmm" /> can we?
"I'll talk to Morgaine."
<g id="g_litearmor_converseleft" />That's an idea. Hopefully the others were able to find her. Now then,<g id="g_litearmor_youknow" /> let's return to our camp, shall we?
<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" />Oh, I do believe I'm actually looking forward to that place.<g id="g_litearmor_concerns" /> I may even be able to get along with Mister Grunts.
"Mister Grunts?"

string.comment: Daichi grunts at Rima in the middle of her speech
string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar

resources.string: <g id="g_litearmor_youknow" />Daichi, of course. Because all<g id="g_litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" /> he does now is grunt at me instead of responding like a proper human being.

string.comment: Daichi grunts at Rima in the middle of her speech
string.speaker: Rima Bahar
string.name: RimaBahar

resources.string: <g id="g_female_lookright" priority="high" />Yes I'm talking to you, Mister Grunts!<g id="g_female_whattheheck" /> Can you believe- did you hear that?
<g id="g_litearmor_complimentplayer" />That is something, really. All of it! Mordred, Artorius, the eternal winter that you spared all of us from.
<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />Another song, waiting to be written-<g id="g_female_handsforwardrequest" /> by my frozen hands! Ah, for just one cup of piping hot tea!
(Dog sniffs at you briefly, then mrrowls in approval. Impossibly, it seems he already knows you've vanquished the enemy.)
"Well, we did it together."
(Dog talks at you extensively- probably an interesting lecture. If only you spoke Lynx.)
(Dog seems to be relaxed and happy again. He greets you and rolls back for a tummy rub. It's probably a trap.)
<g id="g_litearmor_lookuparound" priority="high" />As I suspected, I'm quite glad to be back in our cozy little rodent nest of a camp.
<g id="g_female_lookright" priority="high" />Now is it my imagination, or does even Mister Grunts seem to be less-<g id="g_litearmor_shrugbrief" /> scowly of late?

<g id="g_male_compliment" />Yes my friend, you have outdone yourself with this Mordred, as you<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> always do!<g id="g_female_pointthreaten" /> Evil has no home when you are-<g id="g_male_shrugbrief" /> at home.
<g id="g_female_youknow" />And about that ice wall,<g id="g_female_smackfist" priority="high" /> you know, I cracked it first- by my fist,<g id="g_male_agree1" /> you saw that as well, am I right?
<g id="g_grace_proud" />Yeah, we sailed right through that storm, didn't we?<g id="g_grace_flirt" /> I have to say, you're lucky you found me on the beach that day.
<g id="g_grace_welcome" />I mean, where would you be without me as your First Mate?
<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" />If we were betting odds, I<g id="g_grace_headshakeno" priority="high" /> might have wagered against us.
<g id="g_grace_flirt" />But you and I together, we've got a kind of magic all our own, don't we?<g id="g_grace_smackfist" priority="high" /> We bested that smug arse Mordred.
Travel to Mokosh Springs to stop Mordred from becoming a god
Reach the top of the mountain to find a path to the Ancient temple
Traverse the mountain to reach the Ancient temple where Mordred has gone
Find the waypoint to the Ancient temple where Mordred has gone
A fluttering movement catches your eye. There's a note of some kind by the crates.
Read the note on the ground
Talk to Daichi about the journal note you found
Look for key runes needed to unseal the temple entrance
You feel the dark power of a rune from the valley below. If you could see it, you could capture it.
Use the telescope with Daichi's orb to capture the first key rune
The orb that Daichi gave you burns hot. You've captured the key rune "Ascend!"
Look for the second rune needed to unseal the temple
Collect the last key rune "Fear" needed to unseal the Ancient temple
The capture orb shudders as it absorbs the key rune, "Fear." You can now unlock the temple.
Look for the entrance to the Ancient temple where Mordred has gone
The others are waiting for you here, near the cavern entrance
Let Daichi know you have the runes needed to unlock the temple
Approach the sealed temple door
Talk to Dog
Enter the temple to stop Mordred's transformation
Find Mordred
Paintings on the floor and walls depict three colors of Ancient lizard guardians, facing Corrupted enemies.
Continue your search for Mordred and the ritual chamber
Orient the statues to unlock the ritual chamber door
Heavy Ancient gears grind into motion. You've unlocked the ritual chamber!
Enter the ritual chamber and stop Mordred
Mordred has transformed into a monstrosity, drawing the power of the Ancients from the chamber. Stop him!
Stop Mordred from bringing about an eternal winter
Defeat Mordred
Stop Mordred from bringing about an eternal winter
Tell Rima that you've stopped Mordred
Exit the caves and let Dog know you've defeated Mordred
Let Dog know you've defeated Mordred
Victory! Let the other Crows know you've averted Mordred's threat
From Client to Crow
Mordred has been stopped, and another crisis averted, for now. Share the news with his mother, Morgaine.
<g id="g_grace_shrugdontcare" />To tell the truth, I feel a bit sorry for Morgaine. She acts like she doesn't care, but-
<g id="g_grace_concerns" priority="high" />Skye found her in Mordred's old cabin, tensed up like a cat in water. We uh,<g id="g_grace_gesturerightm" /> may need her help in the future.
"Let's pay her a visit."
<g id="g_grace_understand" />I was hoping you'd say so. Skye just came back, says she tried approaching her, but the sorceress had her jaw set.
<g id="g_grace_no" />Determined to stay out of things. Maybe<g id="g_grace_gestureleftm" /> catch up with Skye. I'll<g id="g_grace_gesturerights" /> join you out there.
<g id="g_grace_cantremember" />To think this entire place, maybe the whole world, would be covered in ice, if it<g id="g_grace_gesturebothhands" /> wasn't for the Silver Crows.
<g id="g_male_complimentplayer" />Yes! I never doubted you, but still-<g id="g_male_sighrelief" /> my heart rested on knives until I saw you arrive.
<g id="g_male_wavehandsnobig" />Not- not that I was simply waiting for you here, whimpering and<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> pining like some kind of<g id="g_female_lifthandsxs" /> weak princess.
"I did stop an eternal winter."
<g id="g_male_leanbackcovermouth" />Ha ha! Yes. You did and for that<g id="g_female_bowshallow" /> you have my deepest thanks. And<g id="g_female_gesturerightm" /> respect.

<g id="g_female_shakeheadno" />But now, we should tell Morgaine what's happened to her son.<g id="g_male_headtilthmm" /> She plays the uncaring mother, but<g id="g_female_shrugnothingicando" /> even now she haunts his cabin.

<g id="g_yonas_nodbig" />In a short time I have had a very satisfying adventure with you. I was<g id="g_yonas_shrug" /> correct to pretend to lose our match.<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" /> I am joking with you!
"You- joke?"
<g id="g_yonas_noddingslow" />Yes. Though, most of the time people do not understand my sense of humor. Dog understands.
<g id="g_yonas_lookright" priority="high" />He is much more intelligent than most of the others suspect.
"Are you happy with the Crows?"

<g id="g_yonas_explain01" />You have just saved- perhaps the entire world from eternal winter. And you ask me,<g id="g_yonas_headtilthmm" /> am I happy to be here?<g id="g_yonas_laughbig" /> Ha ha ha!

<g id="g_yonas_shrugdontcare" priority="high" />The food is terrible. The decoration?<g id="g_yonas_shakehead" priority="high" /> Painful. But the company-<g id="g_yonas_righthand01" /> I am satisfied.

<g id="g_yonas_shrug" />These people seem- less noisy than before.<g id="g_yonas_onehandoutnoway" /> No, I still do not like them. But- they are less noisy. Even<g id="g_yonas_lefthand" /> the big hat lady.<g id="g_yonas_waghanddisagree02" priority="high" /> Yes, yes, I will try to get along, as you say.
He froze, you say? Do you mean, into solid ice? I see. I see. Ha ha ha ha ha.
I’m sorry, these emotions. It is unlike me. Life has not been easy with him. Nor he with it. But, thank you- for trying to talk sense into him.
"Do you- need time alone?"
I'm certainly not crying, if that's what you're asking. Not for that selfish chick. But I am his mother, so I suppose I will retrieve him.
I just hope. I hope I can show him peace. Do you know, he was a kind boy, once.

<g id="g_female_headshakesmall" />To see the look on her face. I feel<g id="g_male_guiltylookdown" /> some- shame, for wishing her son to suffer.<g id="g_male_whatwantfromme" /> Perhaps a parent can never leave behind their bond, even if they<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> wish to do so.

The Glacial Tarn (Expedition)
Shailyn has found another way into the underground caverns in Great Cleave. She wants you to pursue Ser Loth and destroy him.
Your arrival is a boon from the gods. Though you defeated Ser Marius, we haven't yet routed the true evil- Loth.
Thankfully, I've found another way into the ancient halls where he seeks power- the Glacial Tarn.
"Ser Loth is here?"
Yes, right through this gateway, in fact. But as you can imagine, there's more in the way of getting to Loth than just this door.
Not only his allies, the Varangians, but powerful magic. Primordial. And most deadly.
"I’ll get Loth. I don't fear him."
Thank you. I could not ask for a stronger ally than you.
But remember, that foul get has not only consumed the flame of the Empyrean Forge, but now steeps himself in the ancient ice magic from the Glacial Tarn. Be wary.
Though the challenge before us is mighty, I can think of none more able to face it, than you.
You will not stop me.
I will put Shailyn to an end. But first, you.
I will put Shailyn's meddling to an end. Starting with you.
You have doomed Aeternum!
Tell Shailyn her pathetic attempt has failed.
Carry my regards to Shailyn.
As expected, the strong prevail.
Was this outcome ever in question?
You've done it. You've actually, actually done it. Forgive me. I- I have spent a lifetime, pursuing that vile bastard, Loth.
I am in your debt. More than you know. And at last, there shall be rest.

The Ice of Life (Expedition)

The healer Ao Wei, is interested in the potential for curative powers of ice found in the Glacial Tarn in Great Cleave. He wants you to collect samples of any interesting ice formations that you find deep in the caverns.
Well met to you, my friend. I see that you, like me, are here to uncover the mysteries of the Glacial Tarn.
I have a simple request if you are willing. Venture within, and gather for me, specimens of the ice formations found here.
"You want me to gather ice?"
That is correct! But this ice- it has properties unlike anything I have ever seen. Is it the purity of the water?
The magical essence it soaks in? I must have more samples to study! Please, will you help me?
"Yes, I'll get your ice samples."
Thank you! Wonderful! I would go myself, you see, but I am a healer, not a fighter.
I have seen enough horrible wounds on those I treat- I would not want to see the monsters of this Glacial Tarn in person.
Beyond its healing properties, I believe these ice formations hold a secret to our life here on Aeternum.
Ah! I see you have returned! And you have the ice formations! Excellent! I knew you were the right person to ask for aid!
If ever you are in need of healing, seek me out! I shall return this favor to you then, I assure you!
